website_summaries.verdict: Offer similar features to other heated socks at a reasonable price, but they also come with quite a few quality issues that potentially hinder their effectiveness.
pros: Socks fall on the middle of the price range and offer useful features including 3 heat settings, comfortable construction, and easy charging
cons: Some owners complain that they don't distribute heat evenly and that customer service is subpar
Battery life isn't as long as some competitors

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable and have really good quality. The battery pack is small enough that it doesn’t interfere with anything or stick into your leg. The heat is pretty instant once you turn it on; however, I wish it was a little more intense and a little bigger. This could possibly make it bulgy or uncomfortable. Overall a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Kendell

customer_reviews.title: Raynauds
customer_reviews.text: I’m pretty sure I have Raynauds when I realized my toes turn blue when it’s spring out and my family has the air conditioner on. This did the trick and my toes are finally warm! I wear a regular pair of socks first then these on top so they don’t smell. I’ve pretty much had them odor free and it’s been a few months since I started wearing them without needing to wash. I did a quick handwash once and air dry and they were fine. I didn’t soak them in water and was gentle. These are lifesavers!
customer_reviews.author: Prod_Doc

customer_reviews.title: VERY warm and easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: The socks are extremely easy to use and like that they are long so the controls are well above boot tops. You can charge both batteries at the same time with the special plug which is nice so they are both ready at the same time. They are soft and warm up quickly and will make snow plowing this winter much better.
customer_reviews.author: Leips63

customer_reviews.title: Work amazing!
customer_reviews.text: They work great! I would recommend wearing a thinner pair of socks beneath as they r not really washable.
customer_reviews.author: Jarin Seibel

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR OUTDOOR WINTER SPORTS
customer_reviews.text: FANTASTIC SOCKS ! PERFECT FOR NYC WINTER BIKE RIDING. HEAT IN TOES WHERE NEEDED. WE TOOK THESE ON A WINTER VACATION & CAN'T SAY HOW AMAZING IT WAS TO HAVE THEM !!!! REALLY GOOD QUALITY , 3 HEAT LEVELS TO PROLONG BATTERY LIFE IS VERY APPRECIATED FOR MORE THAN A FEW HOURS OUT IN COLD.
customer_reviews.author: ren

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely worthless!
customer_reviews.text: What more can I say. The socks were comfortable. But there was nothing about the heating part that worked - at all. If you want to pay $50 for nothing but a pair of socks, go for it. They were packaged up for return the day after I got them. I might try a different brand. But "once bitten, twice shy". And I'm not going to pay $150-$200 for the higher end - especially when I don't know how well they'll work.
customer_reviews.author: Danetta Davis

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks for my Ironworker son. He is out in the brutal cold all day - up to 10 hours. He was severely disappointed that these electric socks could not keep his feet warm. He said that his toes were freezing and the tops of his feet were lukewarm. The heating element is only on the top of the foot. Big disappointment - especially when you factor in the cost of these socks. Was expecting so much more. I will be returning these socks.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda M. Harper

customer_reviews.title: Awesome heated socks
customer_reviews.text: These socks work great! I plan on using these socks regularly with the colder temperatures coming up and they keep my feet warm and cozy. I don't find them too thick and they feel pretty comfortable. I also like how there's different temperature settings depending on how hot you want your feet to get.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good after 1st use
customer_reviews.text: I've used these once and they worked well. I had them on the lowest setting and my feet did not get cold after several hours sitting in the cold. The only downside is the battery life is not great- it's about what they say it is. Since you can't wash these I suggest you wear a pair underneath these that you CAN wash. Overall, I'm satisfied for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan S.

customer_reviews.title: Does not keep your feet warm
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money on this product. I wore these in 30° weather hunting. They did not keep my feet warm at all on the highest heat setting. The next day I had to go back to my traditional wool socks. My feet were much warmer with my wool socks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Warm feet
customer_reviews.text: They are nice and warm and well made I am not. Long sock person but these fit nicely haven't had them long enough to make a good evaluation
customer_reviews.author: Bill Eberle

customer_reviews.title: Cozy but you can't wash them
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings on these. On the one hand my feet get super cold and having anything to help that is great. On the other hand it's kind of a bummer that they don't heat more of your foot (the heat kind of runs across the top of your foot like the highlighted area on the photo) and that you can't wash them. I understand that you can't wash wires, but it would have been nice if these came with a thin removable liner sock or something. I would feel like the price was more appropriate if that were the case.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Heats up 5% of your feet
customer_reviews.text: At the highest heat setting, only the top of my feet were warmed, next to (but not including) my toes. I was hoping these socks would warm up my whole feet, not just the part that were in contact with the heating pad. Why is the heating pad so small?
customer_reviews.author: R. Berahovich

customer_reviews.title: Does not heat up enough
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my father. They do not heat up enough to warm the foot. Save your money and dont buy this.
customer_reviews.author: Walla-Walla

customer_reviews.title: These fit just like my regular socks.
customer_reviews.text: But these are not regular socks. These socks are heated and super toasty warm on my feet and toes. In the video attached, you will see how I fit the battery in the little pocket on the side of the sock, and you will get to see how they fit on me when there are powered up and ready to heat my feet. I am going to love these warm socks on powder days. When I am up snowboarding this year.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: So far not impressed especially for the price. I expected these to actually warm my feet. On a full charge these are not really heating at all.
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Owens

customer_reviews.title: Long charge time
customer_reviews.text: The socks work well for my wife who suffers from Raynaud's and fibromyalgia, however, it is stated that recharge time is 4 - 5 hours. More like 6 - 8 hours depending on how far they have discharged. With that long of a recharge period a second set of batteries is recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Only got one battery for two socks.
customer_reviews.text: Missing a battery ! Only one battery for two socks. Poor quality control.
customer_reviews.author: Rherf44

customer_reviews.title: Save your $
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the $$. Broke after 2wks of use. I work in a freezer (-temp) and they helped a little. Not what I was looking for. Maybe if your just shoveling snow from in front the house they'll work for you.
customer_reviews.author: George Grimes

customer_reviews.title: Not hot and only somewhat warm in a 1 inch band over your toes. Best temp 30C (86F)
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. My Lasergrip 800 shows room temp at 21C (69.8F) Best temps I have after charging over night and starting for 30 min on green then 30 min on orange and hours on red. Simply NOT HOT with best temps at 30C (86f) mid point, 27C (80,6F) right side. 26C (78.8F) left side and 30C (86F) mid upper foot. There is no heat coming from anywhere else but a 1 inch band directly on top of your toes. Rest of my foot feels nothing. These are going back. They are comfortable but I am not spending this kind of money for soft socks.
customer_reviews.author: LKNANML

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping/hunting
customer_reviews.text: The socks actually is pretty thick, comes with a charger and 2 batteries. I got this for my hubby for hunting. He haven’t used it For hunting yet but we charged it and used it while sleeping. Keep feet warm. The only thing is I don’t think it’s machine washable because the socks contain wires. So I’ve been carefully Hand washing them.
customer_reviews.author: Tung Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: They get warm-ish.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be honest here I really looked forward to this product to be sadly disappointed on how not very well this works, for one, it only "warms" the top of your feet. Second the battery life sucks, these things don't ever seen to get charged. Third, I can barely feel the warmth... It's very sad how much I wanted these to work but they don't very well.
customer_reviews.author: Chyanne Rey

customer_reviews.title: Really helps for those who get cold feet easy
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I have poor circulation in my feet, and even when sitting my feet would be cold. This was a nice alternative when I wanted to go out instead of trying to find a blanket to go under to stay warm. I now instead just wear these socks. I like that they don't feel like they're pointy and pokey metal and look normal. Ski season is over for me but I expect these to last long enough to go through that as well next year. I am not sure they were worth the price for just skiing but I think they are worth it if you're serious about keeping circulation in your feet.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous Platypus

customer_reviews.title: Nice and toasty
customer_reviews.text: The socks showed up super quick. Using them was super easy to figure out. They are comfortable. The first battery charge took a little bit. Once you turn them on it doesnt take long for them to warm up. I had them on the highest level while i was walking around my house and the heat was great. I tried them in shoes too. In shoes i bumped down to the lowest level and was toasty for over an hour. I really like these. I coach soccer and fall and spring in wisconain can get windy and cold. I will definately be wearing these.
customer_reviews.author: Cory S

customer_reviews.title: Burned My Foot
customer_reviews.text: Not bad if you just want a pair of socks. I used them with the battery on one occasion and had them on level 2. Used them for a couple of hours. When I took the socks off, I had a burn blister on the top of my foot. I even wore another pair of socks under the heated socks. They did keep the top of my foot warm, but I would not recommend them for 2 reasons. 1. They burn your foot, and 2. To really keep your feet warm, you need to have the heat on the bottom of the foot, not the top. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Michele L. Mengert

customer_reviews.title: Got the largest size. Very tight.  Burned my feet even on LOW
customer_reviews.text: These fit like compression socks but I can put them on with some difficulty. At least they don't ride down. They work very well with good insulated boots at keeping your feet warn. But with the heating element directly on my feet, causes burn marks just above my toes even at the lowest setting. Ok though when I wear another pair of socks between these and my feet. Batteries last up to six hours. Takes about as long to charge as they run at the low setting. Charge indicator is on the wallwart, NOT on the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: The Dancing Banana

customer_reviews.title: Would not recomend if you have reynaud syndrome
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these four me because my feet are always freezing. I kept having ro check if the were on because my feet would stay cold. If I had pants on I would have to pull my pants down in order to get the the switch to check if they were on. The pocket is in an annoying location. I remove the warmer so I can wash the socks with is a huge downfall. When they are on they really only warm on the top of the foot not a warmth all over.
customer_reviews.author: Anna  Young

customer_reviews.title: Cold feet no more!
customer_reviews.text: My feet are always cold! Even when it’s 100+ degrees outside my feet are ice cold! Lol so I wanted some socks with heat so that I don’t have to keep them in my heat pad and can actually walk and move around. I bought these as an investment as in my head the less I stress about my cold feet the more work I get done. So far I use these regularly and feel like I am in front of a chimney and drinking hot chocolate lol can’t wait for when it’s cold season and I have these 24/7, will need to get more pairs now.
customer_reviews.author: Bella Chow

customer_reviews.title: Toasty Toes
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable well made socks the heating element lands right about where your toes meet your foot ontop (does not wrap around the front of your toes) I havent bothered with the lower settings because I bought heated socks I want my toes HOT It could honestly be maybe a smidge warmer in my opinion. The one bad thing ive noticed is my right sock doesnt seem to have as big of an area of effect as the left one or isnt putting out as much heat. but it still better than freezing my toes off at work
customer_reviews.author: Casey Rosa

customer_reviews.title: They Do The Job Well
customer_reviews.text: Sock wise these are made Great. Warms the tops of my toes and mybe an inch back nicely and fairly fast. The only grip I have and it could be because I've got a 13w size foot but the heating pad and sock fiber gets imprinted to my feet when I take them off other than that I'd say they are the best out there
customer_reviews.author: scottr

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: They helped a little but not as warm as I thought. Not worth sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Edwina

customer_reviews.title: Keep your feet snug and warm in below 0 wind chills
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my son that is in school in Minnesota to help keep his feet warm when working and standing on cold concrete. He loves them and has 3 control settings so you won't burn your feet like other units that dont have a settings switch. Thanks alot big time "Yeah"!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pruitt

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Worthless!
customer_reviews.text: Do NOT buy these socks. They are probably the worst item I have ever purchased on Amazon. They absolutely do not stay warm. The batteries just turn off. The design is terrible. The only good thing about them is that the actual socks are comfortable, so thumbs up to the sock designer, but as for a heated sock DO NOT BUY THESE! Plus I returned them 2 weeks ago and my return hasn’t even started to go through. DO NOT BUY THESE SOCKS!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby T

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough to be meaningful
customer_reviews.text: My wife tried them twice. Her feet are always cold and I thought these could be perfect for her. We confirmed that the socks were functioning, and you could tell that there were multiple heat settings, but even on high, she said they weren't significantly warmer than a second pair of socks would have been. We both REALLY wanted these to be great, but this product just fell short. Very disappointed. We decided to return them.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen C. Hammond

customer_reviews.title: Nice and warm on your toes, love these!
customer_reviews.text: When I first ordered these I thought this was a gimmick. Turned out to be a real treat. Love using them in the winter. Battery snaps into wires easy and fits in little pockets on the outside of the socks. Easy to unsnap the batteries and charge them when not in use. Battery lasts several wearings. Socks (w/o the batteries) wash in the washing machine, but on delicate so the wires don't get damaged. Dry them on top of the dryer using the heat coming up from the dryer when its running. Have never put them in the dryer. Socks are still relatively soft even without going in dryer. Love these!
customer_reviews.author: CA

customer_reviews.title: They need an extra set of batteries
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for long sits while hunting. I hike in with normal wool socks then I put these on before I climb the tree. They definitely work but they seem to automatically turn off on their own after a while. These with the Icebreaker Boot blankets worked great for all day sits. I wish there was a way to recharge them off a USB. Or if spare batteries were cheaper than the socks!
customer_reviews.author: AJ Dubé

customer_reviews.title: Socks are great, but..
customer_reviews.text: If you hunt, remember to turn them on before you get in your tree stand, and to leave the "on" button portion out of the sock. Bent down to turn them on "high" setting, and had 2 deer barreling toward me fighting, as I was digging for the on button to my socks. If I wasn't messing with the sock id have me a nice 8 pointer.
customer_reviews.author: J_A_251

customer_reviews.title: Not warm enough for football games
customer_reviews.text: I’m going to keep these because of the price (lower than others), and I don’t want to go through the hassle of returning them. I am a football wife with poor foot circulation, so I really needed something like this on those freezing late fall nights. These would get warm, but I still had to add foot warmers to my boots to keep my feet warm. They are comfortable. Maybe I just got a faulty pair [shrug], but I’m not planning to reorder to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Good for Winter Cycling
customer_reviews.text: I use these warming socks for winter bike riding, they worked great down to about 22*F for my hour+ ride. I’m sure they’ll work fine for colder temps but after about 45 minute, the bottom of my feet get very cold (the heating element is at the top of the toes). I wish the heating element was removable which would allow me to throw the socks in the washer, I currently hand wash them.
customer_reviews.author: Fredw

customer_reviews.title: Extra battery needed
customer_reviews.text: It's nice that it comes with 3 levels low medium and hot but if you have it on hot you lose quite a few hours on the battery and I kind of wish that it would come with an extra type of battery
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: They keep my feet warm.
customer_reviews.text: I actually primarily bought these to wear in our basement, which gets pretty chilly. I work from home down there, so my feet get cold. These cotton socks are thick and comfortable and keep my feet warm even before I turn on the heat. When the socks are heated, my feet stay nice and toasty. I’m looking forward to the winter for outdoor wear.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great heated socks
customer_reviews.text: I bought these socks because, my apartment is the basement of a house and it gets chilly down there in the winter time. These socks are great very warm the only downside of course is the battery life. Only a one day use and then needs charging. And it takes about 6 hours for it to charge from dead to full but if you can get the charge schedule down they work great.
customer_reviews.author: Nick C.

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I picked up a set for my daughter's BF as a gift. He hunts and says he has comfort covered everywhere except his feet, so this was an experiment to see if it'd help. It didn't. One side barely warmed and the other was almost imperceivable. It wasn't worth returning, but we won't get more of them, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Scott McCrory

customer_reviews.title: Diabetic foot issues
customer_reviews.text: I am diabetic, so my feet go from icy cold to burning up in the evening. I started wearing these socks to bed and it really helps with the frozen foot stage of my nightly existence. I put them on about an hour before bedtime and then tuck my feet under the covers until they start to feel warm. I then pull them off, turn off the battery, and at least half my problem is solved. The only downside that I can see is that the battery life could be longer. Other than that, they have been an excellent choice for me and my condition.
customer_reviews.author: A.J. Fox

customer_reviews.title: Wished I bought more than one pair when it was on amazon daily deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who, bless his heart, takes my sons' boy scout troop on a lot of outdoor adventures. He used them on the annual snow camping trip and loved them. And, because he is an amazing dad, he let our son use them at night so his feet would be warm. They both came back from that trip raving about them! We also used them snowshoeing and had to play rock-paper-scissors for who got to use them. I plan on getting another pair, hopefully on sale, before next fall.
customer_reviews.author: mamaz

customer_reviews.title: So great!
customer_reviews.text: So far they work as advertised. They say to soft wash them. But no other instructions on cleaning. So I have to figure out what "soft wash "means. .. But other than that they have been awesome. I have ranauds syndrome and my feet get icy cold nothing has worked to keep them warm till these. Worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: Dashford

customer_reviews.title: Pathetic battery life, not actually that warm
customer_reviews.text: In order to get any kind of warmth on my feet, I had to turn the heat up to the highest setting, which lasts less than an hour. Then you have to charge your batteries overnight before you can use them again. Practically useless. I will admit that I have very small feet so the socks were probably looser than intended, but that doesn't excuse the poor battery life.
customer_reviews.author: The Readingmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Too short for boots
customer_reviews.text: They work fine and keep my feet warm for more than 5 hrs on low. I think the socks are too short. If the battery could be above the boot top it would be better. The battery digs into your leg, would be impossible and painful with ski boots. Also the socks are pretty tight at the top. I had to make a slit in the top ribbing.
customer_reviews.author: DCE

customer_reviews.title: Finally warmth!
customer_reviews.text: I recently moved to the Northwest and am about to experience my first cold winter. I work outside a lot and my toes recently got a bad case of Chilblains. I have Raynaud's and I knew I would have to do something or there was no way I would get through this cold winter. I purchased these socks and they are amazing! You can tell they are good quality. I can't wait to have warm feet all winter and not have to use those disposable feet warmers.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great socks.  Just what I needed for those really cold mornings.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are super comfortable and warm. I primarily use the socks for early morning waterfowl hunts. Prior to purchase my feet would get uncomfortably cold. The first time I tried these in the field they were game changers. Nothing is worse than frozen feet in the duck blind but I shouldn't have to deal with that anymore. I also purchased a thin pair of merino wool socks as a liner under these and the combo is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Tightlines127

customer_reviews.title: Problems
customer_reviews.text: They get warm and work well.. when they work. Mine only came with 1 working battery. The other one won't charge. Can't find a way to contact the seller other than to outright return them. Can't even find a way to buy spare batteries. This type seems to come with this product only.
customer_reviews.author: Niki H

customer_reviews.title: Comfy socks. Must be worn with boots.
customer_reviews.text: I liked that they did heat up a small amount and that the battery is fairly discreet. I did not like that the socks must be worn inside of a boot or a bigger sock to retain the heat or to heat up a foot that is already cold. Overall, the product works but takes some getting used to. Sock material is good and soft. Worth the money I paid for them since they do heat up. The batteries took about 8 hours to charge the first time I charged them.
customer_reviews.author: Cfowler

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my cold feet warm!
customer_reviews.text: I sit at a lot of sporing events during the cold seasons of the year. I typically don't have problems keeping my feet warm as long as I move around occasionally but this isn't possible while sitting at sporting events. These socks feel good and are warm with no heat applied. The three heat settings work well and I can feel the heat in 20 degree temps even on the low setting. The longest that I have used these socks as about 5 hours on medium heat and they stayed warm the entire time!
customer_reviews.author: Brian B.

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars
customer_reviews.text: They take long time to full charge. You leave them overnight to full charge and barely last 2 hours on high and 5-6 hours on medium. If your feet is cold the medium will not warm them only the high setting will. The pair I bought also had batteries with different working time as one will last longer than other.
customer_reviews.author: Mohamad

customer_reviews.title: Great for chilly evenings
customer_reviews.text: The large size will probably fit between 8-12 pretty well. They side packs and wire running to foot took some wearing to get used to but after awhile you forget about those things. The heat generated on low and medium range from luke warm to warm . I felt high was too much and wouldn't use that setting. Overall really pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: UFZBR

customer_reviews.title: Mediocre at best
customer_reviews.text: Socks are soft and well made. On the highest setting, the socks are barely warm. There was enough heat to keep my toes warm in high 30's/low 40's weather, but can't imagine they will be sufficient in colder weather (I live in the northeast). Also, the battery pack is too large and pulls against my jeans. Next year will look for another manufacturer that provides a warmer sock and a smaller battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: Beverly Doran & Greg Olbrys

customer_reviews.title: Game changer, throw away the HotHands paks!
customer_reviews.text: Game changer. After years of getting freezing cold feet and toes hunting, this product solved it. At 32 degrees outside I still only need the medium setting and it lasts over 4 hours. Made a world of difference hunting this year. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Louthan

customer_reviews.title: Nice box they came in
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the directions of how to charge these batteries,,, had to return one pair because they did not heat up, got the second pair I dont know yet about these as they are a gift,,,I will never purchase these again, I will go elsewhere
customer_reviews.author: Delores Koscielski

customer_reviews.title: Keeps feet warm
customer_reviews.text: These socks were great quality and keeps feet warm. I do wish you could through them in the washer rather than hand washing them. You do need to charge them up before wearing them or they will not work correctly and I do recommend wearing them more as slippers and wear socks under them
customer_reviews.author: ABS92276

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t work at all, would have been warmer had I lit the $45 on fire and used it to warm my toes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not terribly effective
customer_reviews.text: I used these on a day in the 40’s to watch a parade. I expected it to be colder that day, but I figured I’d try them anyway. I didn’t feel a lot of heat from these. Not sure if they would have felt warmer if it had been colder or if my feet would have just frozen!
customer_reviews.author: Ann Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Go for another brand.
customer_reviews.text: It does not heat up very well. Hardly noticeable. I like the batteries are rechargeable.
customer_reviews.author: Valentin Astorga

customer_reviews.title: defeats the purpouse
customer_reviews.text: while i did manage to get the product to work after turning on the second time and a complete charge i am not impressed with the fact that the only time i notice the heat is when i am inside. the whole reason i bought these was to use them while working outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Good for Light Use
customer_reviews.text: I have a tendency to get (literal) cold feet when the rest of me is at a comfortable temperature. These socks do a good job of helping me when this happens, but I'm not sure how well they do in a 'real' cold situation.
customer_reviews.author: B.Eastman

customer_reviews.title: Large size is more like a medium
customer_reviews.text: Socks heat, but the wire to the heating pad is inside the elastic sock, so it presses into the leg & foot making them very uncomfortable to wear. will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom K.

customer_reviews.title: Could be warmer
customer_reviews.text: Meh... thought these heated socks would be warmer then advertised, not boiling hot but just a comfortable warmth. Yah I’m wearing these socks when it in the high 20’s but I don’t feel much heat coming off of them. I tried them on the medium setting and I felt a little heat but then I turned them on high and not much better, they do have a full charge but if I were able to stick my feet in my armpits. My armpits would be warmer, so I’ll try a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: 5 to 6 hour battery life
customer_reviews.text: These socks have saved the lifespan of my toes this winter! I work on an open dock and my steel toes do nothing to combat the heat. Putting these socks on makes everything better! The battery life lasts for about 5 to 6 hours on high.
customer_reviews.author: Miss Dee

customer_reviews.title: Awesome warm purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: These socks were amazing at keeping my feet toasty during spring baseball. I kept them on several hours and didn't run the charge all the way out. I wish they were a little smaller, I wear a women's size 8 and they're a little big. I haven't washed them yet, so I don't know how they're going to hold up there. But they're a lifesaver still!! Buy these, you won't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Mountain Mama

customer_reviews.title: They work great! Even on sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: These really, really work. I cant wait to use them in the hunting stand. They warm up really fast and dont get too hot, but keep you nice and warm. I have incredibly sensitive skin and I was a little worried about them, but they are great. I wish I had splurged on these a long time ago. Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin VanWormer

customer_reviews.title: Use on the couch
customer_reviews.text: They heat up and keep your feet warm however the battery pack that hangs off the side is very uncomfortable. You cannot ski or snowboard with them you just have to be sitting so I guess they’re great for icefishing. Not very soft.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Garbage product. Charged to 100%. Put on and turned on high. Barely any noticeable heat AT ALL. Literally couldn't even tell if they were on. Lights were on. Power was on. No heat to speak of. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: jktrainer

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: The first time I wore these, I put it on the medium setting and was good for a decent amount of time, but it got colder over the next couple of days so put it on the high setting and only lasted a couple of hours. Disappointed the high doesn’t last longer.
customer_reviews.author: Morgan3boys

customer_reviews.title: Not worth price
customer_reviews.text: Heat is minimal even on higher setting. Heat is only on top of sock. I would have liked to heat the bottom of the foot. Very expensive. I planned to return it but missed the final return date.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna

customer_reviews.title: 6 hours of heating
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these as a gift, he is 6’4 tall and the socks were not long enough. I wish they were long enough to go up a tall person leg. It had 6 hours of heating time, that’s ok but not long enough. I was hoping at least a 8 hour of heating. Every UPS driver in cold weather should have a pair.
customer_reviews.author: DEBORA HENRY

customer_reviews.title: Not so great!
customer_reviews.text: These socks didn’t warm that great on the highest setting.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: missing batteries and charger
customer_reviews.text: I never thought to check this item out, until I received the other pair today. Same thing, no batteries or charger. The first pair I bought had them, so I know they come with it. Lesson learned, check EVERYTHING as soon as it comes in. What good are they to me now??
customer_reviews.author: alan rush

customer_reviews.title: Good battery life/comfy and easy to use but just don't get very hot.
customer_reviews.text: ...and only heats above my toes? Strange. My shoes are cold too! Need heat all over. I returned even though comfy enough. Heat was never HOT, just kept feet at room temp when outside. Huh.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my wife, glad I tried them before Christmas. They didn't heat at all. Put them on high for 20 minutes, and they didn't feel any warmer than room temperature.
customer_reviews.author: S. Amado

customer_reviews.title: Not fit for all applications....
customer_reviews.text: Decent socks, but if you are wearing tall boots for example for hunting they are a pain. Get ones with wireless controls. Good product make my feet sweat though, which is bad when battery runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Tim H.

customer_reviews.title: Great Socks!
customer_reviews.text: This sock are great. Me and my husband both got a pair for hunting season. They kept our feet warm and we actually even wore them to a couple of football games. The high heat gets HOT we usually do the middle level. It’s not like say sitting on a heated seat. We almost forget we are wearing them. We just know our feet quit getting cold while using them. Very pleased with these!
customer_reviews.author: Dorothy Tinsley

customer_reviews.title: Warm, but not for very long.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't impressed with these socks. The buttons on the battery are easy to bump and change the setting while wearing. They were warm, but even on the highest setting the heat only lasted about 1 hour. After that, they are still warm but not enough to keep your feet warm on a cold day.
customer_reviews.author: justin

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: These socks are extremely tight on your calves, so if you like that, buy them. For me, they stopped circulation in minutes and I pulled them off immediately.
customer_reviews.author: David Mutina

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have raynards syndrome,typically in the winter my toes become bruised and swollen.these socks have really made a difference this past winter.battery seems to last a good time.if anything would probably want to be able to get a spare set of batteries.
customer_reviews.author: joe young

customer_reviews.title: Decent set with little disappointment
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift for a close family friend of mine who always has cold feet- literally, not metaphorically. She has has nothing but good things to say about these, other than the size wasn't perfect. It was a good gift that didn't disappoint in quality. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Game changers
customer_reviews.text: These socks are a game changer. I have severe Raynauds and these keep my foot warm outside. The heating element covers the toes. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for hunting. Could not feel any heat from them. Socks wanted to slide down all the time and batteries wouldn't stay in the pockets. When I did take them off, it seemed like they absorbed moisture and were wet.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Husband loves them! Warms his feet up like expected. He is so tall so his feet get cold fast. He was very excited to get these for Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Mock

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money. Can’t be washed properly.
customer_reviews.text: Wore these for hunting in November and December in Western PA. 15degrees out and they did nothing for warmth. The battery lasted from a full charge on low heat for 4 hours. Not worth the money. And the heat pad is only for the top arch of your foot. Nothing for your toe area. The fact that they are not machine washable is a disappointment as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for warm feet on cold days
customer_reviews.text: Waiting for replacement socks the first pair didn't heat up but amazon is gladly and quickly sending new ones. If they don't work will refund purchase and try different brand. Will send updated reply when I get other pair tested.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moorman

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift and thought they were expensive! I have been told they are AMAZING! So, I would definitely recommend these heated socks, but follow the directions!
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!! DO NOT BUY!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the batteries stopped working the first couple of days. I tried to talk to the seller and had no luck. I would recommend buying a different brand. Customer service does not exist.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Good luck on customer support
customer_reviews.text: I have given this company a lot of time and multiple opportunities to respond to my requests on replacement. The product arrived and was not as advertised, one pair of socks even had a wire that would poke your foot. I bought the replacement plan for these as well and absolutely nothing. Save yourself some time and frustrations and buy something else. I will update this post once my emails are responded to and order returned. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Marlow

customer_reviews.title: Best socks ever!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my husband several years ago. He wore them almost every day during the winter. The batteries lasted for maybe three years before they stopped working. I ordered another pair of these socks since they lasted longer than expected. The wires in the socks were lasted, I thought they would be the first to go but it was the rechargable batteries that needed to be replaced. They seem durable.
customer_reviews.author: McMicken Oulette

customer_reviews.title: Warm and perfect for cold weather
customer_reviews.text: I have a terrible time with pain in my feet from cold weather. Usually this isn’t too big of a deal, because I live in Louisiana. However, we got a hard freeze last night and it’s been freezing cold for 2 days, and these socks saved me from excruciating pain! The battery lasts a long time and they really are super warm, without being overly hot. Will be buying a second pair.
customer_reviews.author: LLRod

customer_reviews.title: Not really for your wife with cold feet
customer_reviews.text: The tops are feet are super hot but after 15 minutes, the bottoms of my feet and my toes are icy like usual. I just thought they would be amazing and they're not.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly M Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Do not work. Tried to reach out to seller. No response. Do not keep feet warm. Charged over 24 hrs. Placed on all heat settings and no difference than any other socks.My omni heat boots do a much better job. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: pillhill

customer_reviews.title: Glad I purchased these
customer_reviews.text: These are great and I should know because my feet stay cold. However, my tors still suffer a bit. The sock gets hot on top of my feet but it takes longer to reach my toes and by that time the batteries are waning. But I’m glad I made the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Did its job, but...
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised but had to use on the lowest setting because stopped providing heat after 2hrs. Another hunter at camp suggested I buy a second pair and carry extra batteries afield for 6-8hr sits.
customer_reviews.author: I Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: The wires feels like it’s burning you and not heating, the battery package is big and now comfortable at all. Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Shahar A.

customer_reviews.title: Not machine washable, but still great.
customer_reviews.text: Hand washing is a lost art these days. Although the battery box is removable, the heating element is permanent. Even with caution, I'm sure longterm they will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Tater

product_meta.title: GLOBAL VASION Heated Scoks Winter Electric Rechargeable 3 Heating Settings Thermal Sock for Men and Women
feature_bullets: Electric rechargeable heated socks for chronically cold feet ( Heated Area: Front instep)
3 Levels Temperature Setting: High (Red), medium (Orange) and Low (Green)

Electric Foot Warmers: Absorbent, breathable, elastic thickened, super soft & cozy, padded reinforced heel & toe,and recessed heating element help focus heat in the toe to keep your feet from getting cold
Great for hunting, skiing,ice fishing, hiking, and sporting events. Won't shock, even when wet!
Includes (1) pair of socks, (2) 3.7V li-ion rechargeable batteries, (1) ac charger
